co.paralleluniverse.fibers.futures

Class AsyncListenableFuture<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.paralleluniverse.fibers.FiberAsync<V,ExecutionException>
      • co.paralleluniverse.fibers.futures.AsyncListenableFuture<V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class AsyncListenableFuture<V>
extends FiberAsync<V,ExecutionException>
    Turns Google Guava's ListenableFutures into a fiber-blocking operation.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <V> V get(ListenableFuture<V> future)
      Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes, and returns its result.
      static <V> V get(ListenableFuture<V> future, long timeout, TimeUnit unit)
      Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes - but no longer than the given timeout - and returns its result.
      static <V> V get(ListenableFuture<V> future, Timeout timeout)
      Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes - but no longer than the given timeout - and returns its result.
      protected void requestAsync()
      A user of this class must override this method to start the asynchronous operation and register the callback.
      protected V requestSync()
      Called if FiberAsync.run() is not being executed in a fiber.

      • get

        public static <V> V get(ListenableFuture<V> future)
             throws ExecutionException,
                    InterruptedException,
                    SuspendExecution
        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes, and returns its result.
        Parameters:
        future - the future
        Returns:
        the future's result
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the future's computation threw an exception
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
        SuspendExecution

      • get

        public static <V> V get(ListenableFuture<V> future,
        long timeout,
        TimeUnit unit)
             throws ExecutionException,
                    InterruptedException,
                    SuspendExecution,
                    TimeoutException
        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes - but no longer than the given timeout - and returns its result.
        Parameters:
        future - the future
        timeout - the maximum duration to wait for the future's result
        unit - the timeout's time unit
        Returns:
        the future's result
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the future's computation threw an exception
        TimeoutException - if the timeout expired before the future completed
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
        SuspendExecution

      • get

        public static <V> V get(ListenableFuture<V> future,
        Timeout timeout)
             throws ExecutionException,
                    InterruptedException,
                    SuspendExecution,
                    TimeoutException
        Blocks the current strand (either fiber or thread) until the given future completes - but no longer than the given timeout - and returns its result.
        Parameters:
        future - the future
        timeout - the method will not block for longer than the amount remaining in the Timeout
        Returns:
        the future's result
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the future's computation threw an exception
        TimeoutException - if the timeout expired before the future completed
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting
        SuspendExecution

      • requestAsync

        protected void requestAsync()
        Description copied from class: FiberAsync
        A user of this class must override this method to start the asynchronous operation and register the callback. This method may not use any ThreadLocals.
        Specified by:
        requestAsync in class FiberAsync<V,ExecutionException>

      • requestSync

        protected V requestSync()
                 throws ExecutionException,
                        InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: FiberAsync
        Called if FiberAsync.run() is not being executed in a fiber. Should perform the operation synchronously and return its result. The default implementation of this method throws an `IllegalThreadStateException`.
        Overrides:
        requestSync in class FiberAsync<V,ExecutionException>
        Returns:
        The operation's result.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        ExecutionException
